verses.verseString: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ
verses.verseStringB: In the name of Allah, the Compassionate, the Merciful.

verses.verseString: طه
verses.verseStringB: O man,ᵃ

verses.verseString: مَا أَنْزَلْنَا عَلَيْكَ الْقُرْآنَ لِتَشْقَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: We have not revealed the Qur’ān to thee that thou mayest be unsuccessful;ᵃ

verses.verseString: إِلَّا تَذْكِرَةً لِمَنْ يَخْشَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: But it is a reminder to him who fears:

verses.verseString: تَنْزِيلًا مِمَّنْ خَلَقَ الْأَرْضَ وَالسَّمَاوَاتِ الْعُلَى
verses.verseStringB: A revelation from Him Who created the earth and the high heavens.ᵃ

verses.verseString: الرَّحْمَٰنُ عَلَى الْعَرْشِ اسْتَوَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: The Beneficent is established on the Throne of Power.

verses.verseString: لَهُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا وَمَا تَحْتَ الثَّرَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth and whatever is between them and whatever is beneath the soil.

verses.verseString: وَإِنْ تَجْهَرْ بِالْقَوْلِ فَإِنَّهُ يَعْلَمُ السِّرَّ وَأَخْفَى
verses.verseStringB: And if thou utter the saying aloud, surely He knows the secret, and what is yet more hidden.ᵃ

verses.verseString: اللَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ لَهُ الْأَسْمَاءُ الْحُسْنَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Allāh — there is no God but He. His are the most beautiful names.

verses.verseString: وَهَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ مُوسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And has the story of Moses come to thee?

verses.verseString: إِذْ رَأَىٰ نَارًا فَقَالَ لِأَهْلِهِ امْكُثُوا إِنِّي آنَسْتُ نَارًا لَعَلِّي آتِيكُمْ مِنْهَا بِقَبَسٍ أَوْ أَجِدُ عَلَى النَّارِ هُدًى
verses.verseStringB: When he saw a fire, he said to his people: Stay, I see a fire; haply I may bring to you therefrom a live coal or find guidance at the fire.ᵃ

verses.verseString: فَلَمَّا أَتَاهَا نُودِيَ يَا مُوسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: So when he came to it, a voice came: O Moses,

verses.verseString: إِنِّي أَنَا رَبُّكَ فَاخْلَعْ نَعْلَيْكَ ۖ إِنَّكَ بِالْوَادِ الْمُقَدَّسِ طُوًى
verses.verseStringB: Surely I am thy Lord, so take off thy shoes; surely thou art in the sacred valley Ôuwā.ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَأَنَا اخْتَرْتُكَ فَاسْتَمِعْ لِمَا يُوحَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And I have chosen thee so listen to what is revealed:

verses.verseString: إِنَّنِي أَنَا اللَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا أَنَا فَاعْبُدْنِي وَأَقِمِ الصَّلَاةَ لِذِكْرِي
verses.verseStringB: Surely I am Allāh, there is no God but I, so serve Me, and keep up prayer for My remembrance,

verses.verseString: إِنَّ السَّاعَةَ آتِيَةٌ أَكَادُ أُخْفِيهَا لِتُجْزَىٰ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ بِمَا تَسْعَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Surely the Hour is coming — I am about to make it manifesta — so that every soul may be rewarded as it strives.

verses.verseString: فَلَا يَصُدَّنَّكَ عَنْهَا مَنْ لَا يُؤْمِنُ بِهَا وَاتَّبَعَ هَوَاهُ فَتَرْدَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: So let not him, who believes not in it and follows his low desire, turn thee away from it, lest thou perish.

verses.verseString: وَمَا تِلْكَ بِيَمِينِكَ يَا مُوسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And what is this in thy right hand, O Moses?

verses.verseString: قَالَ هِيَ عَصَايَ أَتَوَكَّأُ عَلَيْهَا وَأَهُشُّ بِهَا عَلَىٰ غَنَمِي وَلِيَ فِيهَا مَآرِبُ أُخْرَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He said: This is my staff — I lean on it, and I beat the leaves with it for my sheep, and I have other uses for it.

verses.verseString: قَالَ أَلْقِهَا يَا مُوسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He said: Cast it down, O Moses.

verses.verseString: فَأَلْقَاهَا فَإِذَا هِيَ حَيَّةٌ تَسْعَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: So he cast it down, and lo! it was a serpent, gliding.ᵃ

verses.verseString: قَالَ خُذْهَا وَلَا تَخَفْ ۖ سَنُعِيدُهَا سِيرَتَهَا الْأُولَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He said: Seize it and fear not. We shall return it to its former state.

verses.verseString: وَاضْمُمْ يَدَكَ إِلَىٰ جَنَاحِكَ تَخْرُجْ بَيْضَاءَ مِنْ غَيْرِ سُوءٍ آيَةً أُخْرَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And press thy hand to thy side, it will come out white without evil — another sign:ᵃ

verses.verseString: لِنُرِيَكَ مِنْ آيَاتِنَا الْكُبْرَى
verses.verseStringB: That We may show thee of Our greater signs.

verses.verseString: اذْهَبْ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّهُ طَغَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Go to Pharaoh, surely he has exceeded the limits.

verses.verseString: قَالَ رَبِّ اشْرَحْ لِي صَدْرِي
verses.verseStringB: He said: My Lord, expand my breast for me:

verses.verseString: وَيَسِّرْ لِي أَمْرِي
verses.verseStringB: And ease my affair for me:

verses.verseString: وَاحْلُلْ عُقْدَةً مِنْ لِسَانِي
verses.verseStringB: And loose the knot from my tongue,ᵃ

verses.verseString: يَفْقَهُوا قَوْلِي
verses.verseStringB: (That) they may understand my word.

verses.verseString: وَاجْعَلْ لِي وَزِيرًا مِنْ أَهْلِي
verses.verseStringB: And give to me an aider from my family:ᵃ

verses.verseString: هَارُونَ أَخِي
verses.verseStringB: Aaron, my brother;

verses.verseString: اشْدُدْ بِهِ أَزْرِي
verses.verseStringB: Add to my strength by him,

verses.verseString: وَأَشْرِكْهُ فِي أَمْرِي
verses.verseStringB: And make him share my task —

verses.verseString: كَيْ نُسَبِّحَكَ كَثِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: So that we may glorify Thee much,

verses.verseString: وَنَذْكُرَكَ كَثِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: And much remember Thee.

verses.verseString: إِنَّكَ كُنْتَ بِنَا بَصِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: Surely, Thou art ever Seeing us.

verses.verseString: قَالَ قَدْ أُوتِيتَ سُؤْلَكَ يَا مُوسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He said: Thou art indeed granted thy petition, O Moses.

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدْ مَنَنَّا عَلَيْكَ مَرَّةً أُخْرَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And indeed We bestowed on thee a favour at another time,

verses.verseString: إِذْ أَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ أُمِّكَ مَا يُوحَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: When We revealed to thy mother that which was revealed:

verses.verseString: أَنِ اقْذِفِيهِ فِي التَّابُوتِ فَاقْذِفِيهِ فِي الْيَمِّ فَلْيُلْقِهِ الْيَمُّ بِالسَّاحِلِ يَأْخُذْهُ عَدُوٌّ لِي وَعَدُوٌّ لَهُ ۚ وَأَلْقَيْتُ عَلَيْكَ مَحَبَّةً مِنِّي وَلِتُصْنَعَ عَلَىٰ عَيْنِي
verses.verseStringB: Put him into a chest, then cast it into the river, the river will cast it upon the shore — there an enemy to Me and an enemy to him shall take him up. And I shed on thee love from Me; and that thou mayest be brought up before My eyes.ᵃ

verses.verseString: إِذْ تَمْشِي أُخْتُكَ فَتَقُولُ هَلْ أَدُلُّكُمْ عَلَىٰ مَنْ يَكْفُلُهُ ۖ فَرَجَعْنَاكَ إِلَىٰ أُمِّكَ كَيْ تَقَرَّ عَيْنُهَا وَلَا تَحْزَنَ ۚ وَقَتَلْتَ نَفْسًا فَنَجَّيْنَاكَ مِنَ الْغَمِّ وَفَتَنَّاكَ فُتُونًا ۚ فَلَبِثْتَ سِنِينَ فِي أَهْلِ مَدْيَنَ ثُمَّ جِئْتَ عَلَىٰ قَدَرٍ يَا مُوسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: When thy sister went and said: Shall I direct you to one who will take charge of him? So We brought thee back to thy mother that her eye might be cooled and she should not grieve.ᵃ And thou didst kill a man, then We delivered thee from grief, and tried thee with (many) trials. Then thou didst stay for years among the people of Midian. Then thou camest hither as ordained, O Moses.ᵇ

verses.verseString: وَاصْطَنَعْتُكَ لِنَفْسِي
verses.verseStringB: And I have chosen thee for Myself.

verses.verseString: اذْهَبْ أَنْتَ وَأَخُوكَ بِآيَاتِي وَلَا تَنِيَا فِي ذِكْرِي
verses.verseStringB: Go thou and thy brother with My messages and be not remiss in remembering Me.

verses.verseString: اذْهَبَا إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّهُ طَغَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Go both of you to Pharaoh, surely he is inordInᵃ te;

verses.verseString: فَقُولَا لَهُ قَوْلًا لَيِّنًا لَعَلَّهُ يَتَذَكَّرُ أَوْ يَخْشَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Then speak to him a gentle word, haply he may mind or fear.

verses.verseString: قَالَا رَبَّنَا إِنَّنَا نَخَافُ أَنْ يَفْرُطَ عَلَيْنَا أَوْ أَنْ يَطْغَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: They said: Our Lord, we fear lest he hasten to do evil to us or be inordInᵃ te.

verses.verseString: قَالَ لَا تَخَافَا ۖ إِنَّنِي مَعَكُمَا أَسْمَعُ وَأَرَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He said: Fear not, surely I am with you — I do hear and see.

verses.verseString: فَأْتِيَاهُ فَقُولَا إِنَّا رَسُولَا رَبِّكَ فَأَرْسِلْ مَعَنَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ وَلَا تُعَذِّبْهُمْ ۖ قَدْ جِئْنَاكَ بِآيَةٍ مِنْ رَبِّكَ ۖ وَالسَّلَامُ عَلَىٰ مَنِ اتَّبَعَ الْهُدَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: So go you to him and say: Surely we are two messengers of thy Lord; so send forth the Children of Israel with us; and torment them not. Indeed we have brought to thee a message from thy Lord, and peace to him who follows the guidance.

verses.verseString: إِنَّا قَدْ أُوحِيَ إِلَيْنَا أَنَّ الْعَذَابَ عَلَىٰ مَنْ كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
verses.verseStringB: It has indeed been revealed to us that punishment will overtake him who rejects and turns away.ᵃ

verses.verseString: قَالَ فَمَنْ رَبُّكُمَا يَا مُوسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: (Pharaoh) said: Who is your Lord, O Moses?

verses.verseString: قَالَ رَبُّنَا الَّذِي أَعْطَىٰ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ خَلْقَهُ ثُمَّ هَدَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He said: Our Lord is He Who gives to everything its creation, then guides (it).ᵃ

verses.verseString: قَالَ فَمَا بَالُ الْقُرُونِ الْأُولَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He said: What then is the state of the former generations?

verses.verseString: قَالَ عِلْمُهَا عِنْدَ رَبِّي فِي كِتَابٍ ۖ لَا يَضِلُّ رَبِّي وَلَا يَنْسَى
verses.verseStringB: He said: The knowledge thereof is with my Lord in a book; my Lord neither errs nor forgets —

verses.verseString: الَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الْأَرْضَ مَهْدًا وَسَلَكَ لَكُمْ فِيهَا سُبُلًا وَأَنْزَلَ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً فَأَخْرَجْنَا بِهِ أَزْوَاجًا مِنْ نَبَاتٍ شَتَّىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Who made the earth for you an expanse and made for you therein paths and sent down water from the clouds. Then thereby We bring forth pairs of various herbs.

verses.verseString: كُلُوا وَارْعَوْا أَنْعَامَكُمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِأُولِي النُّهَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Eat and pasture your cattle. Surely there are signs in this for men of understanding.

verses.verseString: مِنْهَا خَلَقْنَاكُمْ وَفِيهَا نُعِيدُكُمْ وَمِنْهَا نُخْرِجُكُمْ تَارَةً أُخْرَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: From it We created you, and into it We shall return you, and from it raise you a second time.

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدْ أَرَيْنَاهُ آيَاتِنَا كُلَّهَا فَكَذَّبَ وَأَبَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And truly We showed him all Our signs but he rejected and refused.

verses.verseString: قَالَ أَجِئْتَنَا لِتُخْرِجَنَا مِنْ أَرْضِنَا بِسِحْرِكَ يَا مُوسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Said he: Hast thou come to us to turn us out of our land by thy enchantment, O Moses?

verses.verseString: فَلَنَأْتِيَنَّكَ بِسِحْرٍ مِثْلِهِ فَاجْعَلْ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَكَ مَوْعِدًا لَا نُخْلِفُهُ نَحْنُ وَلَا أَنْتَ مَكَانًا سُوًى
verses.verseStringB: We too can bring to thee enchantment like it, so make an appointment between us and thee, which we break not, (neither) we nor thou, (in) a central place.

verses.verseString: قَالَ مَوْعِدُكُمْ يَوْمُ الزِّينَةِ وَأَنْ يُحْشَرَ النَّاسُ ضُحًى
verses.verseStringB: (Moses) said: Your appointment is the day of the Festival, and let the people be gathered in the early fore - noon.

verses.verseString: فَتَوَلَّىٰ فِرْعَوْنُ فَجَمَعَ كَيْدَهُ ثُمَّ أَتَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: So Pharaoh went back and settled his plan, then came.

verses.verseString: قَالَ لَهُمْ مُوسَىٰ وَيْلَكُمْ لَا تَفْتَرُوا عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا فَيُسْحِتَكُمْ بِعَذَابٍ ۖ وَقَدْ خَابَ مَنِ افْتَرَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Moses said to them: Woe to you! Forge not a lie against Allāh, lest He destroy you by punishment, and he fails indeed who forges (a lie).

verses.verseString: فَتَنَازَعُوا أَمْرَهُمْ بَيْنَهُمْ وَأَسَرُّوا النَّجْوَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: So they disputed one with another about their affair and kept the discourse secret.

verses.verseString: قَالُوا إِنْ هَٰذَانِ لَسَاحِرَانِ يُرِيدَانِ أَنْ يُخْرِجَاكُمْ مِنْ أَرْضِكُمْ بِسِحْرِهِمَا وَيَذْهَبَا بِطَرِيقَتِكُمُ الْمُثْلَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: They said: These are surely two enchanters who would drive you out from your land by their enchantment, and destroy your excellent institutions.

verses.verseString: فَأَجْمِعُوا كَيْدَكُمْ ثُمَّ ائْتُوا صَفًّا ۚ وَقَدْ أَفْلَحَ الْيَوْمَ مَنِ اسْتَعْلَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: So settle your plan, then come in ranks, and he will succeed indeed this day who is uppermost.

verses.verseString: قَالُوا يَا مُوسَىٰ إِمَّا أَنْ تُلْقِيَ وَإِمَّا أَنْ نَكُونَ أَوَّلَ مَنْ أَلْقَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: They said: O Moses, wilt thou cast, or shall we be the first to cast down?

verses.verseString: قَالَ بَلْ أَلْقُوا ۖ فَإِذَا حِبَالُهُمْ وَعِصِيُّهُمْ يُخَيَّلُ إِلَيْهِ مِنْ سِحْرِهِمْ أَنَّهَا تَسْعَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He said: Nay! Cast you down. Then lo! their cords and their rods — it appeared to him by their enchantment as if they ran.ᵃ

verses.verseString: فَأَوْجَسَ فِي نَفْسِهِ خِيفَةً مُوسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: So Moses conceived fear in his mind.ᵃ

verses.verseString: قُلْنَا لَا تَخَفْ إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الْأَعْلَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: We said: Fear not, surely thou art the uppermost.

verses.verseString: وَأَلْقِ مَا فِي يَمِينِكَ تَلْقَفْ مَا صَنَعُوا ۖ إِنَّمَا صَنَعُوا كَيْدُ سَاحِرٍ ۖ وَلَا يُفْلِحُ السَّاحِرُ حَيْثُ أَتَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And cast down what is in thy right hand — it will eat up what they have wrought. What they have wrought is only the trick of an enchanter, and the enchanter succeeds not wheresoever he comes from.

verses.verseString: فَأُلْقِيَ السَّحَرَةُ سُجَّدًا قَالُوا آمَنَّا بِرَبِّ هَارُونَ وَمُوسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: So the enchanters fell down prostrate, saying: We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses.

verses.verseString: قَالَ آمَنْتُمْ لَهُ قَبْلَ أَنْ آذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ الَّذِي عَلَّمَكُمُ السِّحْرَ ۖ فَلَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُمْ مِنْ خِلَافٍ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ فِي جُذُوعِ النَّخْلِ وَلَتَعْلَمُنَّ أَيُّنَا أَشَدُّ عَذَابًا وَأَبْقَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: (Pharaoh) said: You believe in him before I give you leave! Surely he is your chief who taught you enchantment. So I shall cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides and I shall crucify you on the trunks of palm-trees, and you shall certainly know which of us can give the severer and the more abiding chastisement.

verses.verseString: قَالُوا لَنْ نُؤْثِرَكَ عَلَىٰ مَا جَاءَنَا مِنَ الْبَيِّنَاتِ وَالَّذِي فَطَرَنَا ۖ فَاقْضِ مَا أَنْتَ قَاضٍ ۖ إِنَّمَا تَقْضِي هَٰذِهِ الْحَيَاةَ الدُّنْيَا
verses.verseStringB: They said: We cannot prefer thee to what has come to us of clear arguments and to Him Who made us, so decide as thou wilt decide. Thou canst only decide about this world’s life.

verses.verseString: إِنَّا آمَنَّا بِرَبِّنَا لِيَغْفِرَ لَنَا خَطَايَانَا وَمَا أَكْرَهْتَنَا عَلَيْهِ مِنَ السِّحْرِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ خَيْرٌ وَأَبْقَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Surely we believe in our Lord that He may forgive us our faults and the magic to which thou didst compel us. And Allāh is Best and ever Abiding.

verses.verseString: إِنَّهُ مَنْ يَأْتِ رَبَّهُ مُجْرِمًا فَإِنَّ لَهُ جَهَنَّمَ لَا يَمُوتُ فِيهَا وَلَا يَحْيَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Whoso comes guilty to his Lord, for him is surely hell. He will neither die therein, nor live.ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَمَنْ يَأْتِهِ مُؤْمِنًا قَدْ عَمِلَ الصَّالِحَاتِ فَأُولَٰئِكَ لَهُمُ الدَّرَجَاتُ الْعُلَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And whoso comes to Him a believer, having done good deeds, for them are high ranks —

verses.verseString: جَنَّاتُ عَدْنٍ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ جَزَاءُ مَنْ تَزَكَّىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Gardens of perpetuity, wherein flow rivers, to abide therein. And such is the reward of him who purifies himself.

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدْ أَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ أَنْ أَسْرِ بِعِبَادِي فَاضْرِبْ لَهُمْ طَرِيقًا فِي الْبَحْرِ يَبَسًا لَا تَخَافُ دَرَكًا وَلَا تَخْشَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And certainly We revealed to Moses: Travel by night with My servants, then strike for them a dry path in the sea, not fearing to be overtaken, nor being afraid.ᵃ

verses.verseString: فَأَتْبَعَهُمْ فِرْعَوْنُ بِجُنُودِهِ فَغَشِيَهُمْ مِنَ الْيَمِّ مَا غَشِيَهُمْ
verses.verseStringB: So Pharaoh followed them with his armies, then there covered them of the sea that which covered them.

verses.verseString: وَأَضَلَّ فِرْعَوْنُ قَوْمَهُ وَمَا هَدَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And Pharaoh led his people astray and he guided not aright.

verses.verseString: يَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ قَدْ أَنْجَيْنَاكُمْ مِنْ عَدُوِّكُمْ وَوَاعَدْنَاكُمْ جَانِبَ الطُّورِ الْأَيْمَنَ وَنَزَّلْنَا عَلَيْكُمُ الْمَنَّ وَالسَّلْوَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: O Children of Israel, We truly delivered you from your enemy, and made a covenant with you on the blessed side of the mountain, and sent to you the manna and the quails.

verses.verseString: كُلُوا مِنْ طَيِّبَاتِ مَا رَزَقْنَاكُمْ وَلَا تَطْغَوْا فِيهِ فَيَحِلَّ عَلَيْكُمْ غَضَبِي ۖ وَمَنْ يَحْلِلْ عَلَيْهِ غَضَبِي فَقَدْ هَوَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Eat of the good things We have provided for you, and be not inordInᵃ te in respect thereof, lest My wrath come upon you; and he on whom My wrath comes, he perishes indeed.

verses.verseString: وَإِنِّي لَغَفَّارٌ لِمَنْ تَابَ وَآمَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَالِحًا ثُمَّ اهْتَدَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And surely I am Forgiving toward him who repents and believes and does good, then walks aright.

verses.verseString: وَمَا أَعْجَلَكَ عَنْ قَوْمِكَ يَا مُوسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And what made thee hasten from thy people, O Moses?

verses.verseString: قَالَ هُمْ أُولَاءِ عَلَىٰ أَثَرِي وَعَجِلْتُ إِلَيْكَ رَبِّ لِتَرْضَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He said: They are here on my track, and I hastened on to Thee, my Lord, that Thou mightest be pleased.

verses.verseString: قَالَ فَإِنَّا قَدْ فَتَنَّا قَوْمَكَ مِنْ بَعْدِكَ وَأَضَلَّهُمُ السَّامِرِيُّ
verses.verseStringB: He said: Surely We have tried thy people in thy absence, and the Sāmiri has led them astray.ᵃ

verses.verseString: فَرَجَعَ مُوسَىٰ إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِ غَضْبَانَ أَسِفًا ۚ قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ أَلَمْ يَعِدْكُمْ رَبُّكُمْ وَعْدًا حَسَنًا ۚ أَفَطَالَ عَلَيْكُمُ الْعَهْدُ أَمْ أَرَدْتُمْ أَنْ يَحِلَّ عَلَيْكُمْ غَضَبٌ مِنْ رَبِّكُمْ فَأَخْلَفْتُمْ مَوْعِدِي
verses.verseStringB: So Moses returned to his people angry, sorrowing. He said: O my people, did not your Lord promise you a goodly promise? Did the promised time, then, seem long to you, or did you wish that displeasure from your Lord should come upon you, so that you broke (your) promise to me?

verses.verseString: قَالُوا مَا أَخْلَفْنَا مَوْعِدَكَ بِمَلْكِنَا وَلَٰكِنَّا حُمِّلْنَا أَوْزَارًا مِنْ زِينَةِ الْقَوْمِ فَقَذَفْنَاهَا فَكَذَٰلِكَ أَلْقَى السَّامِرِيُّ
verses.verseStringB: They said: We broke not the promise to thee of our own accord, but we were made to bear the burdens of the ornaments of the people, then we cast them away, and thus did the Sāmiri suggest.ᵃ

verses.verseString: فَأَخْرَجَ لَهُمْ عِجْلًا جَسَدًا لَهُ خُوَارٌ فَقَالُوا هَٰذَا إِلَٰهُكُمْ وَإِلَٰهُ مُوسَىٰ فَنَسِيَ
verses.verseStringB: Then he brought forth for them a calf, a body, which had a hollow sound, so they said: This is your god and the god of Moses; but he forgot.ᵃ

verses.verseString: أَفَلَا يَرَوْنَ أَلَّا يَرْجِعُ إِلَيْهِمْ قَوْلًا وَلَا يَمْلِكُ لَهُمْ ضَرًّا وَلَا نَفْعًا
verses.verseStringB: Could they not see that it returned no reply to them, nor controlled any harm or benefit for them?ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدْ قَالَ لَهُمْ هَارُونُ مِنْ قَبْلُ يَا قَوْمِ إِنَّمَا فُتِنْتُمْ بِهِ ۖ وَإِنَّ رَبَّكُمُ الرَّحْمَٰنُ فَاتَّبِعُونِي وَأَطِيعُوا أَمْرِي
verses.verseStringB: And Aaron indeed had said to them before: O my people, you are only tried by it, and surely your Lord is the Beneficent God, so follow me and obey my order.ᵃ

verses.verseString: قَالُوا لَنْ نَبْرَحَ عَلَيْهِ عَاكِفِينَ حَتَّىٰ يَرْجِعَ إِلَيْنَا مُوسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: They said: We shall not cease to keep to its worship until Moses returns to us.

verses.verseString: قَالَ يَا هَارُونُ مَا مَنَعَكَ إِذْ رَأَيْتَهُمْ ضَلُّوا
verses.verseStringB: (Moses) said: O Aaron, what prevented thee, when thou sawest them going astray,

verses.verseString: أَلَّا تَتَّبِعَنِ ۖ أَفَعَصَيْتَ أَمْرِي
verses.verseStringB: That thou didst not follow me? Hast thou, then, disobeyed my order?

verses.verseString: قَالَ يَا ابْنَ أُمَّ لَا تَأْخُذْ بِلِحْيَتِي وَلَا بِرَأْسِي ۖ إِنِّي خَشِيتُ أَنْ تَقُولَ فَرَّقْتَ بَيْنَ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ وَلَمْ تَرْقُبْ قَوْلِي
verses.verseStringB: He said: O son of my mother, seize me not by my beard, nor by my head. Surely I was afraid lest thou shouldst say: Thou hast caused division among the Children of Israel and not waited for my word.

verses.verseString: قَالَ فَمَا خَطْبُكَ يَا سَامِرِيُّ
verses.verseStringB: (Moses) said: What was thy object, O Sāmiri?

verses.verseString: قَالَ بَصُرْتُ بِمَا لَمْ يَبْصُرُوا بِهِ فَقَبَضْتُ قَبْضَةً مِنْ أَثَرِ الرَّسُولِ فَنَبَذْتُهَا وَكَذَٰلِكَ سَوَّلَتْ لِي نَفْسِي
verses.verseStringB: He said: I perceived what they perceived not, so I took a handful from the footprints of the messenger then I cast it away. Thus did my soul embellish (it) to me.ᵃ

verses.verseString: قَالَ فَاذْهَبْ فَإِنَّ لَكَ فِي الْحَيَاةِ أَنْ تَقُولَ لَا مِسَاسَ ۖ وَإِنَّ لَكَ مَوْعِدًا لَنْ تُخْلَفَهُ ۖ وَانْظُرْ إِلَىٰ إِلَٰهِكَ الَّذِي ظَلْتَ عَلَيْهِ عَاكِفًا ۖ لَنُحَرِّقَنَّهُ ثُمَّ لَنَنْسِفَنَّهُ فِي الْيَمِّ نَسْفًا
verses.verseStringB: He said: Begone then! It is for thee in this life to say, Touch (me) not. And for thee is a promise which shall not fail. And look at thy god to whose worship thou hast kept. We will certainly burn it, then we will scatter it in the sea.ᵃ

verses.verseString: إِنَّمَا إِلَٰهُكُمُ اللَّهُ الَّذِي لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۚ وَسِعَ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ عِلْمًا
verses.verseStringB: Your Lord is only Allāh, there is no God but He. He comprehends all things in (His) knowledge.

verses.verseString: كَذَٰلِكَ نَقُصُّ عَلَيْكَ مِنْ أَنْبَاءِ مَا قَدْ سَبَقَ ۚ وَقَدْ آتَيْنَاكَ مِنْ لَدُنَّا ذِكْرًا
verses.verseStringB: Thus relate We to thee of the news of what has gone before. And indeed We have given thee a Reminder from Ourselves.

verses.verseString: مَنْ أَعْرَضَ عَنْهُ فَإِنَّهُ يَحْمِلُ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ وِزْرًا
verses.verseStringB: Whoever turns away from it, he will surely bear a burden on the day of Resurrection,

verses.verseString: خَالِدِينَ فِيهِ ۖ وَسَاءَ لَهُمْ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ حِمْلًا
verses.verseStringB: Abiding therein. And evil will be their burden on the day of Resurrection —

verses.verseString: يَوْمَ يُنْفَخُ فِي الصُّورِ ۚ وَنَحْشُرُ الْمُجْرِمِينَ يَوْمَئِذٍ زُرْقًا
verses.verseStringB: The day when the trumpet is blown; and We shall gather the guilty, blue-eyed, on that day,ᵃ

verses.verseString: يَتَخَافَتُونَ بَيْنَهُمْ إِنْ لَبِثْتُمْ إِلَّا عَشْرًا
verses.verseStringB: Consulting together secretly: You tarried but ten (days).ᵃ

verses.verseString: نَحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ إِذْ يَقُولُ أَمْثَلُهُمْ طَرِيقَةً إِنْ لَبِثْتُمْ إِلَّا يَوْمًا
verses.verseStringB: We know best what they say when the fairest of them in course would say: You tarried but a day.ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَيَسْأَلُونَكَ عَنِ الْجِبَالِ فَقُلْ يَنْسِفُهَا رَبِّي نَسْفًا
verses.verseStringB: And they ask thee about the mountains.ᵃ Say: My Lord will scatter them, as scattered dust,

verses.verseString: فَيَذَرُهَا قَاعًا صَفْصَفًا
verses.verseStringB: Then leave it a plain, smooth, level,

verses.verseString: لَا تَرَىٰ فِيهَا عِوَجًا وَلَا أَمْتًا
verses.verseStringB: Wherein thou seest no crookedness nor unevenness.

verses.verseString: يَوْمَئِذٍ يَتَّبِعُونَ الدَّاعِيَ لَا عِوَجَ لَهُ ۖ وَخَشَعَتِ الْأَصْوَاتُ لِلرَّحْمَٰنِ فَلَا تَسْمَعُ إِلَّا هَمْسًا
verses.verseStringB: On that day they will follow the Inviter, in whom is no crookedness; and the voices are low before the Beneficent God, so that thou hearest naught but a soft sound.ᵃ

verses.verseString: يَوْمَئِذٍ لَا تَنْفَعُ الشَّفَاعَةُ إِلَّا مَنْ أَذِنَ لَهُ الرَّحْمَٰنُ وَرَضِيَ لَهُ قَوْلًا
verses.verseStringB: On that day no intercession avails except of him whom the Beneficent allows, and whose word He is pleased with.

verses.verseString: يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ وَلَا يُحِيطُونَ بِهِ عِلْمًا
verses.verseStringB: He knows what is before them and what is behind them, while they cannot comprehend it in knowledge.

verses.verseString: وَعَنَتِ الْوُجُوهُ لِلْحَيِّ الْقَيُّومِ ۖ وَقَدْ خَابَ مَنْ حَمَلَ ظُلْمًا
verses.verseStringB: And faces shall be humbled before the Living, the Self-subsistent. And he who bears iniquity is indeed undone.

verses.verseString: وَمَنْ يَعْمَلْ مِنَ الصَّالِحَاتِ وَهُوَ مُؤْمِنٌ فَلَا يَخَافُ ظُلْمًا وَلَا هَضْمًا
verses.verseStringB: And whoever does good works and he is a believer, he has no fear of injustice, nor of the withholding of his due.

verses.verseString: وَكَذَٰلِكَ أَنْزَلْنَاهُ قُرْآنًا عَرَبِيًّا وَصَرَّفْنَا فِيهِ مِنَ الْوَعِيدِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَّقُونَ أَوْ يُحْدِثُ لَهُمْ ذِكْرًا
verses.verseStringB: And thus have We sent it down an Arabic Qur’ān, and have distinctly set forth therein of threats that they may guard against evil, or that it may be a reminder for them.

verses.verseString: فَتَعَالَى اللَّهُ الْمَلِكُ الْحَقُّ ۗ وَلَا تَعْجَلْ بِالْقُرْآنِ مِنْ قَبْلِ أَنْ يُقْضَىٰ إِلَيْكَ وَحْيُهُ ۖ وَقُلْ رَبِّ زِدْنِي عِلْمًا
verses.verseStringB: Supremely exalted then is Allāh, the King, the Truth. And make not haste with the Qur’ān before its revelation is made complete to thee, and say: My Lord, increase me in knowledge.ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدْ عَهِدْنَا إِلَىٰ آدَمَ مِنْ قَبْلُ فَنَسِيَ وَلَمْ نَجِدْ لَهُ عَزْمًا
verses.verseStringB: And certainly We gave a commandment to Adam before, but he forgot; and We found in him no resolve (to disobey).ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَإِذْ قُلْنَا لِلْمَلَائِكَةِ اسْجُدُوا لِآدَمَ فَسَجَدُوا إِلَّا إِبْلِيسَ أَبَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And when We said to the angels: Be submissive to Adam, they submitted except Iblis; he refused.

verses.verseString: فَقُلْنَا يَا آدَمُ إِنَّ هَٰذَا عَدُوٌّ لَكَ وَلِزَوْجِكَ فَلَا يُخْرِجَنَّكُمَا مِنَ الْجَنَّةِ فَتَشْقَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: We said: O Adam, this is an enemy to thee and to thy wife; so let him not drive you both out of the garden so that thou art unhappy.

verses.verseString: إِنَّ لَكَ أَلَّا تَجُوعَ فِيهَا وَلَا تَعْرَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Surely it is granted to thee therein that thou art not hungry, nor naked,

verses.verseString: وَأَنَّكَ لَا تَظْمَأُ فِيهَا وَلَا تَضْحَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And that thou art not thirsty therein, nor exposed to the sun’s heat.ᵃ

verses.verseString: فَوَسْوَسَ إِلَيْهِ الشَّيْطَانُ قَالَ يَا آدَمُ هَلْ أَدُلُّكَ عَلَىٰ شَجَرَةِ الْخُلْدِ وَمُلْكٍ لَا يَبْلَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: But the devil made an evil suggestion to him; he said: O Adam, shall I lead thee to the tree of immortality and a kingdom which decays not?

verses.verseString: فَأَكَلَا مِنْهَا فَبَدَتْ لَهُمَا سَوْآتُهُمَا وَطَفِقَا يَخْصِفَانِ عَلَيْهِمَا مِنْ وَرَقِ الْجَنَّةِ ۚ وَعَصَىٰ آدَمُ رَبَّهُ فَغَوَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: So they both ate of it, then their evil inclInᵃ tions became manifest to them, and they began to cover themselves with the leaves of the garden. And Adam disobeyed his Lord, and was disappointed.ᵃ

verses.verseString: ثُمَّ اجْتَبَاهُ رَبُّهُ فَتَابَ عَلَيْهِ وَهَدَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Then his Lord chose him, so He turned to him and guided (him).

verses.verseString: قَالَ اهْبِطَا مِنْهَا جَمِيعًا ۖ بَعْضُكُمْ لِبَعْضٍ عَدُوٌّ ۖ فَإِمَّا يَأْتِيَنَّكُمْ مِنِّي هُدًى فَمَنِ اتَّبَعَ هُدَايَ فَلَا يَضِلُّ وَلَا يَشْقَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He said: Go forth herefrom both — all (of you) — one of you (is) enemy to another. So there will surely come to you guidance from Me; then whoever follows My guidance, he will not go astray nor be unhappy.

verses.verseString: وَمَنْ أَعْرَضَ عَنْ ذِكْرِي فَإِنَّ لَهُ مَعِيشَةً ضَنْكًا وَنَحْشُرُهُ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ أَعْمَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And whoever turns away from My Reminder, for him is surely a straitened life, and We shall raise him up blind on the day of Resurrection.ᵃ

verses.verseString: قَالَ رَبِّ لِمَ حَشَرْتَنِي أَعْمَىٰ وَقَدْ كُنْتُ بَصِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: He will say: My Lord, why hast Thou raised me up blind, while I used to see?

verses.verseString: قَالَ كَذَٰلِكَ أَتَتْكَ آيَاتُنَا فَنَسِيتَهَا ۖ وَكَذَٰلِكَ الْيَوْمَ تُنْسَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: He will say: Thus did Our messages come to thee, but thou didst neglect them. And thus art thou forsaken this day.

verses.verseString: وَكَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي مَنْ أَسْرَفَ وَلَمْ يُؤْمِنْ بِآيَاتِ رَبِّهِ ۚ وَلَعَذَابُ الْآخِرَةِ أَشَدُّ وَأَبْقَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And thus do We recompense him who is extravagant and believes not in the messages of his Lord. And certainly the chastisement of the Hereafter is severer and more lasting.

verses.verseString: أَفَلَمْ يَهْدِ لَهُمْ كَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُمْ مِنَ الْقُرُونِ يَمْشُونَ فِي مَسَاكِنِهِمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِأُولِي النُّهَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Does it not manifest to them how many of the generations, in whose dwellings they go about, We destroyed before them? Surely there are signs in this for men of understanding.

verses.verseString: وَلَوْلَا كَلِمَةٌ سَبَقَتْ مِنْ رَبِّكَ لَكَانَ لِزَامًا وَأَجَلٌ مُسَمًّى
verses.verseStringB: And had not a word gone forth from thy Lord, and a term been fixed, it would surely have overtaken them.

verses.verseString: فَاصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ قَبْلَ طُلُوعِ الشَّمْسِ وَقَبْلَ غُرُوبِهَا ۖ وَمِنْ آنَاءِ اللَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْ وَأَطْرَافَ النَّهَارِ لَعَلَّكَ تَرْضَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: So bear patiently what they say, and celebrate the praise of thy Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting, and glorify (Him) during the hours of the night and parts of the day, that thou mayest be well pleased.ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَلَا تَمُدَّنَّ عَيْنَيْكَ إِلَىٰ مَا مَتَّعْنَا بِهِ أَزْوَاجًا مِنْهُمْ زَهْرَةَ الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا لِنَفْتِنَهُمْ فِيهِ ۚ وَرِزْقُ رَبِّكَ خَيْرٌ وَأَبْقَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And strain not thine eyes toward that with which We have provided different classes of them, (of) the splendour of this world’s life, that We may thereby try them. And the sustenance of thy Lord is better and more abiding.

verses.verseString: وَأْمُرْ أَهْلَكَ بِالصَّلَاةِ وَاصْطَبِرْ عَلَيْهَا ۖ لَا نَسْأَلُكَ رِزْقًا ۖ نَحْنُ نَرْزُقُكَ ۗ وَالْعَاقِبَةُ لِلتَّقْوَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And enjoin prayer on thy people, and steadily adhere to it. We ask not of thee a sustenance. We provide for thee. And the (good) end is for guarding against evil.

verses.verseString: وَقَالُوا لَوْلَا يَأْتِينَا بِآيَةٍ مِنْ رَبِّهِ ۚ أَوَلَمْ تَأْتِهِمْ بَيِّنَةُ مَا فِي الصُّحُفِ الْأُولَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And they say: Why does he not bring us a sign from his Lord? Has not there come to them a clear evidence of what is in the previous Books?ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَلَوْ أَنَّا أَهْلَكْنَاهُمْ بِعَذَابٍ مِنْ قَبْلِهِ لَقَالُوا رَبَّنَا لَوْلَا أَرْسَلْتَ إِلَيْنَا رَسُولًا فَنَتَّبِعَ آيَاتِكَ مِنْ قَبْلِ أَنْ نَذِلَّ وَنَخْزَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: And if We had destroyed them with chastisement before it, they would have said: Our Lord, why didst Thou not send to us a messenger, so that we might have followed Thy messages before we met disgrace and shame?

verses.verseString: قُلْ كُلٌّ مُتَرَبِّصٌ فَتَرَبَّصُوا ۖ فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ أَصْحَابُ الصِّرَاطِ السَّوِيِّ وَمَنِ اهْتَدَىٰ
verses.verseStringB: Say: Everyone (of us) is waiting, so wait. Soon you will come to know who is the follower of the even path and who goes aright

This shows that in fact there is no limitation upon the   eternity of paradise, and the words except as thy Lord please have been used, in the case of   paradise, only to express the unbounded power and greatness of the Divine Being and the   fact that it is due to God’s pleasure that they are there.
